review_title: NTT DATA UK is a bodyshop with a toxic management culture
pros: Some nice people, who get disillusioned and leave.
cons:
Whatever reviews you read if you decide to join NTT DATA UK do your research. Ask the right questions (they will lie to you) and stay away if low end IT services or bodyshopping is not for you. Before you even come for an interview consider:
- Does NTT DATA UK have genuine practice areas based on shared intellectual property? No. There are squads but this is all fluff, the output of which has not been used to sell into clients in any meaningful way. 
- Does NTT DATA UK limit its consultants’ billable time for strategic purposes? No. As a bodyshop NTT DATA UK bills as much of its consultants’ time as possible, all the time. (In contrast real consultancy firms continually invests time in improving its collective knowledge and performance.) 
- Does NTT DATA UK measure success in terms of profitability per engagement? NTT DATA UK's goal is simply to bill as much as possible as time and materials(T&M) so it can “run the clock” as long as it can. (Real consulting firms use their knowledge to deliver high-value fixed-price engagements.)
- Does NTT DATA UK leverage new skills to build higher-level relationships? In true bodyshop style NTT DATA UK simply adds new skills to its list of “things we do.” (Real consultancy firms analyses and leverage new skills into higher-level client relationships.)

review_title: NTT DATA UK is going places
pros:
The company is trying to put a lot of people initiatives in place to make it a great place to work.  They are working with employees to get our thoughts, suggestions and input which is really good news.  

There is a lot to do, but at least you can be part of it if you feel passionate about change and doing the right thing. 

It won't change overnight, but I can definitely see changes happening and I for one am here to stay.

Good benefits and pay, 25 days holiday and flexible working all help make life easier!
cons:

review_title: NTT DATA - Good Company - Better Work / Life Balance
pros: NTT DATA's team is very good.  All of the people I've worked with are extremely professional and dedicated to creating high quality products for the various clients they work with.  Support is readily available, upward growth is possible if you put in the effort, and, generally, people are friendly and eager to help.
cons: Expectations are high, especially for consultants.  Travel is dependent on contracts negotiated with the client.  So, travel could be 20% or 100% depending on what the client needs.  That can be hard for people with families.  Also, salary increases are not in line with cost of living.  They do make up for this with bonuses, but they are taxed so it's not quite the same thing as a raise.

pros:
location and work from home due to COVID 
Vacation time is not too bad
Large company brand name
cons: Pay is not only lower for industry but low for US standards. tuition reimbursement only for IT certificate programs not for master’s degree .too many job grades so it may take years to make a decent salary so negotiate when hired if possible because your pay won’t change much after that . HR will not respond to basic emails if you have any questions, happened to myself and another coworker. not sure if US HR is based in India or what seems to be the issue . I would confidently say that out of all the companies i’ve worked for it is apparent that NTT Data tries to keep your pay as low as possible. No free water at any location so you have to bring you’re own water to work. NTT DATA really needs to step up their game because they could be a much better company if they focus more on their human capital.

job_title: Head of Business Consulting in London, England

As a result, new tech or new ways of doing things meet real business problems - it's great to be able to see quick returns on investment in real life

review_title: Lousy business practices, low morale, no raises or bonuses
pros: WFH allowed if you don’t live near a campus. Otherwise, you are expected to be in the office every day.
cons: If you work hard all year, your manager rewards you by DOWNGRADING your actual performance measurement. So if you “exceed expectation”, then your manager lowers your rating to “meets expectation.” Why? To fit on some arbitrary bell curve that leadership concocted. Raises and bonuses are nonexistent. This company thinks nothing about sending us on the road for weeks, at the sacrifice of our family life. We are expected to give everything to them, 24/7. Yet we are seldom rewarded for our hard work. The only time my manager reaches out to me is if that manager needs me to do something for them. Morale is at an all time low.

A complete illusion where all the good people do their 1 to 2 years and leave.

+ Growing - it's possible to become a "go to" person in emerging technology as there are so few technical experts.
+ Training - there's a lot of opportunity to go on external courses and to come aware with recognised certifications. There's also a big emphasis on sharing what you've learnt.

- Autocratic - often management talk about a flat management structure, but it's very hierarchical: the huge number of "ranks" illustrates this well. You will get many senior experienced hires that are not downward looking and who are highly sales focused, which does not create a good atmosphere. This is further complicated by an ineffective split in the company itself.

job_title: Senior Technical Specialist/Assistant Managing Director in Chicago, IL
pros: Over a 16 year period with the Revere Group in Chicago as an acquired entity of NTT Data, Americas I was able to develop and meet career goals specializing in Oracle PeopleSoft and Oracle EBS ERP solutions starting out as a Senior Consultant in 1997 and progressing up the chain to the position of Senior Technical Specialist, equivalent to Principle and Senior managing consultants with in the company.  My objectives were clear, to expand my knowledge and skills from PeopleSoft HRMS/HCM into Financials, to acquire skills in other bolt-on products like Ariba Procurement, to work in other ERP spaces like Oracle EBS Financials and HRMS as well as ADP EV3.  Every step of the way, opportunities were there to advanced those skills and talent and lead to project management in Financials and HCM areas in addition to positions requiring a Technical Lead for design, development, testing.  Projects spanned everything from staff augmentation to implementations.  All in all, I found almost all aspects of my employment with NTT Data and The Revere Group to be immensely gratifying.
cons:
While these fall into the "con" area, the are certainly typical during the initial phases of pulling six independent companies into a cohesive and united corporation the size of NTT Data and should not be considered as deterrents to prospective job seekers.

NTT Data is primarily interested in operating with limited; but, knowledgable senior level staffing in the US to  act as lead resources and architects during implementation where offshore resources are heavily utilized to reduce overall project costs to its clients.  As such, training and application of skills need to be developed prior to employment.  Except for in-house CBT style training, very little training is provided.

NTT Data also has an established "bench" policy that if you are not assigned to a project and sit in a benched state for two weeks or up to six weeks at the discretion of the manager reported to, you will be laid off from NTT Data.  Many consulting corporations are following these practices as of late so the advice I have is to be prepared for a layoff financially in case it does happen.

Like all consulting companies this large, travel is expected of all consultants and this may be a negative for some technically and functionally skilled individuals seeking consulting positions locally.

Career development and the ability to move between different areas of the company are highly espoused; but, positions like that are few and far between and generally limited to upper managemnt.

review_title: An utter bodyshopping and low end IT services firm under the guise of Consulting
pros: The only positive about NTT DATA UK is that the location of its offices in Central London.
cons:
There are quite a few negatives about working for NTT DATA UK as detailed below:

1) Cronyism: The defining characteristic of NTT DATA UK is its rampant cronyism and favoritism. You can choose to become a part of the "inner circle" or clique of influential people that are empowered by the very top management of the organisation. Once you become a crony and be a part of the inner circle, then you can expect promotions every year despite the level of your (in)competence. Needless to say, when incompetence is promoted, competence moves away. Many of the old timers at this place appear to live in a make-believe bubble where they think they are part of a great team that is changing the business world or doing some brilliant, path-breaking work. The reality of it is something else(as described below). 
Anyone considering NTT DATA UK must evaluate this aspect as the favoritism at this place can have serious repercussions on your career path.

2) Bodyshopping, not Consulting: NTT DATA UK tries to sell itself as a Consulting firm, however, almost all the projects here are IT Services or pure bodyshopping. This is evident by the fact that most of the lower grade "consultants" would be in IT project management. It was indeed strange to read that the CEO of this firm once spoke in an interview that he had never worked in IT, when the entire business is pure IT Services and body shopping. NTT DATA UK tries hard to leverage the NTT brand and its Japanese roots, along with the achievement of its sister companies, only to fall short in landing any worthwhile consulting projects. 

Anyone who wants to join this firm must be able to filter out the noise of consulting that will be sold to you, and be prepared to work on IT projects. 

3) Lack of competence in management: Owing to the fact that they tend to live in bubble and have only ever worked in IT projects, the middle and upper management possess a level of competence that does not match with the top tier consulting firms of the world. It was a shame to see some really talented youngsters being wasted away on body shopping projects. There is a serious lack of thought leadership because most of the published thought pieces are derivatives of the work from other consulting firms or sister concerns. There is a lack of opportunity to learn from senior management since they can only teach from the limited pool of knowledge or skill that they possess. Anyone considering to join NTT DATA UK must remember that you learn better when you are not the smartest person in the room. 

4) Sheer Toxicity: Although there are many social events to attend, there is a dearth of genuine and healthy camaraderie at NTT DATA UK. There is a persistent feeling of being under scrutiny all the time if you do not belong to the inner circle. The firm endeavors to present an exciting brand to the outer world by encouraging and coaxing employees to write glowing reviews on social media, especially Glassdoor and LinkedIn. As someone has written in an earlier review, I would strongly advise to read the positive reviews with a massive pinch of salt.
